intro: Clypeola semiglabra, commonly known as the smoothleaf clypeola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in grasslands and rocky outcrops. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets surrounded by pale yellow to brown ray florets. Its leaves are typically narrow and semi-glabrous, giving it its common name. Clypeola semiglabra is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
